New Records: Chicago is tied with the 1962 New York Mets for the modern major league record for losses in a season.
Key Match Events: Andrew Benintendi delivered the go-ahead hit in the 10th inning with a single to left-center against José Quijada, helping the White Sox (38-120) put off infamy for the second night in a row.
Korey Lee gave the White Sox a 2-0 lead with a two-run homer in the second.
Lenyn Sosa put Chicago back on top with a tiebreaking solo drive in the fourth against José Suarez.
The Angels loaded the bases in the seventh but came away empty-handed when Kevin Pillar grounded into a double play.
Los Angeles grounded into three double plays in the final four innings, including one with the bases loaded.
Post-Match Reflections: White Sox interim manager Grady Sizemore said, 'We're not going to let anything rattle us. We're going out there and trying to compete and do the best we can to get a win.'

The Angels' manager Ron Washington commented, 'I don't know if it was us or if it was them making pitches. But you certainly were looking for the ball to get in the air right there or a base hit. We just couldn't get it done.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Benintendi received a celebratory drink from teammates after delivering the winning hit.
The White Sox avoided a record-breaking 121st loss for the second consecutive game.
Others: Los Angeles fire crews maxed out, assistance comes from outside county and state
The White Sox pushed ace Garrett Crochet's start back a day to Friday.
